result.execSummary:
The defendant David T Graham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: *Straight time with credit for 6 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period.    
*Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

*Seek and maintain employment and/or school.
*Be given job and vocational training.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

*No controlled substances or alcohol.
*No contact with Monica B., or her residence, Mindy K. or Joseph B. or their residences.
*The Court STRONGLY RECOMMENDS DOSAGE PROBATION.  If on Dosage Probation, no further review dates needed.  If not, the Defendant has to  see the Judge.

*AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
*Practice absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
*The Court ordered THREE (3) months in the House of Corrections as condition of probation, straight time, imposed and STAYED to be used at the Court's discretion. Review on 01/05/16 at 8:30am.
*1/5/2016  STAY LIFTED. To serve 90 days, straight time.  No good time cedit.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.
*50 hours of Community Service.  Defendant to perform 10 hours within first three months.  The Defendant can pick where he wants to do community service at.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David T Graham

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION/COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant David T Graham not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Jennifer Chong-Dropp appears for the Department of Corrections.

Matter here for a review hearing.  Defendant has not been complying with supervision conditions.  The Court ordered the STAY LIFTED and ordered that the Defendant into custody and he is to serve NINETY (90) days STRAIGHT TIME, who no good time credit, at the House of Corrections.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED, Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions.
FILED, Court Memo.

Defendant David T Graham in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Plea/Sentencing.  As to the plea:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    The Court imposed the following sentence:   
AS TO COUNT #1:  The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be ONE (1) year STRAIGHT TIME at the House of Corrections with credit for SIX (6) days time served.  The Court STAYS the sentence and orders probation for TWO (2) YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
 - No controlled substances or alcohol;
 - AODA assessment; treatment, if needed;
 - Seek and maintain employment and/or school;
 - Be given job and vocational training;
 - Practice absolute sobriety.
 - No contact with Monica B., or her residence, Mindy K. or Joseph B. or their residences.
 - 50 hours of Community Service.  Defendant to perform 10 hours within first three months.  The Defendant can pick where he wants to do community service at;
 - The Court ordered THREE (3) months in the House of Corrections as condition of probation, straight time, imposed and STAYED to be used at the Court's discretion.
 - The Court STRONGLY RECOMMENDS DOSAGE PROBATION.  If on Dosage Probation, no further review dates needed.  If not, the Defendant has to  see the Judge.
 - Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period.  If not paid by the end of the probationary period, the balance will result in a civil judgment against Defendant.    

Review date set for January 5, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant David T Graham in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Case in court due to violation (positive marijuana).  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for September 21, 2015 at 8:30am in Branch 30, Judge Conen's court.
The Court indicated this is  the LAST CHANCE on violations.

FILED, Milwaukee County Pretrial Services (Violation Report).

Defendant David T Graham in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter set for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing.  The matter has been adjourned for a plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2015 at 8:30am in Judge Conen's court, Br. 30
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Defendant picked up new charges and is currently in custody.)

Defendant David T Graham in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Projected Plea Hearing/DPA date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
Case adjourned to 08-19-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing/DPA.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant David T Graham in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 6/1/15.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: MONICA B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David T Graham in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Defendant David T Graham in custody.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
